oecd-RD_332WAVE.def: The database classification can be seen in full at http://wds.iea.org/wds/pdf/RDD_Documentation.pdf
oecd-RD_332WAVE.name: Wave energy RD&D, million USD 2021 PPP
oecd-RD_332WAVE.source:
The IEA Energy Technology RD&D (research, development and demonstration) budget database collects budgetary data on research, development and demonstration of various energy technologies in IEA member countries. Energy RD&D covers basic and applied research, experimental development, and demonstration related to the production, storage, transportation, distribution and rational use of all forms of energy.

Data is collected from central or federal government budgets, as well as budgets of state-owned companies.

Shown here are data for the following ocean-related renewable energy sectors:

  • Offshore wind RD&D activities which focus on the performance and the reliability of these technologies.
  • Ocean energy, including technologies that harness the physical properties of the ocean to generate electricity from tidal energy, wave energy, and salinity gradient power. RD&D activities for this sector includes the design and development of equipment and turbine technology, as well as the research on the effect on marine life of ocean energy.

http://wds.iea.org/WDS/TableViewer/tableView.aspx

"Detailed Country RD&D Budgets" - Accessed November 2020
